revised_title: William Nicolson's Contributions to the Study of the Bewcastle Cross
tldr: This article discusses the work of William Nicolson, a 17th-century bishop and member of the Royal Society, in studying and documenting the Bewcastle Cross, an important and historically significant Northumbrian artifact. Nicolson's research and findings on the Bewcastle Cross, including his drawings of the runic texts, have been valuable to modern scholars of Old English linguistics and runology.
